title: American_Top_40_1981_September_26th
description:
"You're listening to the countdown of this week's most popular songs. Up six notches to number 27, jazz vocalist Al Jarreau with his first pop hit, "We're In This Love Together."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

A listener wants to know how many songs during the rock era have debuted in the top ten? Casey says that after 26 years and more that 3,000 top tens, only three acts have ever done it, and one of those did it more than once.

Casey tells about an artist who turned down offers to leave his group and go solo for 27 years. If you saw "Little Shop Of Horrors," he voiced Audry II, the man-eating plant from outer-space.

Another listener wants to know if any all-white acts have ever hit number one on the soul chart. Casey lists eight acts that have.

Casey names the most successful male singer, female singer, and group from Australia.

The only black group to ever to hit the top 40 on the country chart has a song in this countdown.

Hear Casey say, "Accroches-toi a ton reve."

LW#1: Endless Love - Diana Ross & Lionel Richie
